meanings.sent1: The night sky became daker as the sun set.
meanings.sent2: Her daker hair contrasted beautifully with her fair skin.
meanings.sent3: The room felt daker after the light bulb flickered and went out.
meanings.sent4: His mood grew daker as the storm clouds gathered overhead.
meanings.sent5: The forest became daker as the trees blocked out the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Dak: a post or pile used to support a structure
meanings.sent1: The builders placed a daker firmly in the ground for the new fence.
meanings.sent2: The old barn needed new dak to prevent it from collapsing.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel perched on the daker to get a better view of the garden.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ruins still had remnants of the daks that once held up the walls.
meanings.sent5: The dock was sturdy thanks to the strong daks supporting it.

meanings.definition: Dak: to hurry or run quickly
meanings.sent1: She had to dak to catch the bus before it left.
meanings.sent2: The children would dak across the field to reach the playground faster.
meanings.sent3: The cat would dak around the house when it heard the sound of a can opening.
meanings.sent4: He had to dak through the crowd to get to the front of the line.
meanings.sent5: The athlete would dak towards the finish line with determination.
